intro: Pellionia australis, commonly known as the New Zealand nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes other members commonly referred to as nettles. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Pellionia australis is often used in traditional Māori medicine for its purported healing properties.
